title: Commission Regulation (EC) No 25/2002 of 8 January 2002 concerning the issue of import licences for certain preserved mushrooms
header:
Commission Regulation (EC) No 25/2002
of 8 January 2002
concerning the issue of import licences for certain preserved mushrooms
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
recitals:
,
Having regard to the Treaty establishing the European Community,
Having regard to Commission Regulation (EC) No 2125/95 of 6 September 1995 opening and providing for the administration of Community tariff quotas for preserved mushrooms(1), as last amended by Regulation (EC) No 2541/2001(2), and in particular Article 6(4) thereof,
Whereas:
(1) Article 6(4) of Regulation (EC) No 2125/95 lays down that where the quantities applied for exceed the quantity available, the Commission must set a flat-rate percentage reduction and suspend the issue of licences in respect of subsequent applications.
(2) The quantities applied for on 2 and 3 January 2002 pursuant to Article 4(1)(b) of Regulation (EC) No 2125/95 exceed the quantity available. As a result, the extent to which licences may be issued and the issue of licences for all subsequent applications should be suspended,
main_body: Import licences applied for pursuant to Article 4(1)(b) of Regulation (EC) No 2125/95 on 2 and 3 January 2002 and submitted to the Commission on 4 January 2002 shall be issued, bearing the wording laid down in Article 11(1) of that Regulation, for 16,84 % of the quantity applied for.
The issue of import licences applied for pursuant to Article 4(1)(b) of Regulation (EC) No 2125/95 shall be suspended for applications submitted from 4 January until 14 October 2002.

This Regulation shall enter into force on 9 January 2002.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 8 January 2002.
For the Commission
Franz Fischler
Member of the Commission
(1) OJ L 212, 7.9.1995, p. 16.
(2) OJ L 341, 22.12.2001, p. 80.
